abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            providing social services and social protection to the
            people in rural Togo. For more than 15 years, starting in
            the 1990s, a socio-political crisis affected the economy of
            Togo and hampered the capacity of the government to provide
            adequate social services to the majority of its population.
            The Community Development Project, funded by World Bank had
            reached more than three million beneficiaries in about four
            hundred rural communities. The beneficiaries had been
            provided with basic socioeconomic infrastructure,
            opportunities to generate income, and social safety nets
            including meals for schoolchildren and construction of
            public works.
